Name: Q Sensor
Description:
PRODUCT FEATURES:
- Quick and reliable motion alerts to Z-Wave hub
- Accurate temperature and humidity monitoring
- Lux sensor for smart light automations
- Battery or Micro USB power
- The latest S2 security and Z-Wave Plus chip
- Supports OTA firmware updates
- Built-in tamper switch for extra security

SPECIFICATIONS:
- Model Number: ZSE11
- Z-Wave Signal Frequency: 908.42 MHz
- Power: 2 x CR123A (3 V) batteries / Micro USB
- Motion Detection: up to 20 feet
- Humidity Detection Range: 0 – 100 %
- Light Sensor Detection Range: 0 – 65535 lux
- Operating Temperature: 32° – 104° F
- Dimensions: 2.3” x 2.3” x 2.2”
- Range: Up to 130 feet line of sight
- Installation and Use: Indoor only
Description_Short: Q Sensor is a motion, temperature, humidity, and light sensor.

AssociationGroups.Description: Basic set command sent to devices in Group 2

ConfigurationParameters.Name: Motion Sensitivity
ConfigurationParameters.Description: Adjust motion sensitivity where 8 is the most sensitive setting.

ConfigurationParameterValues.Description: sensitivity levels where 8 is the most sensitive
ConfigurationParameterValues.DescriptionJSONSafe: sensitivity levels where 8 is the most sensitive

ConfigurationParameters.Name: Motion Clear Time
ConfigurationParameters.Description: Set motion clear time for the delay before the sensor reports no motion to the hub and associated devices after detecting the last motion activity.

ConfigurationParameters.Name: Basic Set Commands
ConfigurationParameters.Description: Decide whether the sensor should send basic set commands to Group 2 when motion is detected.

ConfigurationParameters.Name: Basic Set Value
ConfigurationParameters.Description: Decide whether the sensor should send basic set on or off commands to Group 2 when motion is detected.

ConfigurationParameterValues.Description: send 0xFF (ON) when motion is detected and 0x00 (OFF) when motion stops
ConfigurationParameterValues.DescriptionJSONSafe: send 0xFF (ON) when motion is detected and 0x00 (OFF) when motion stops

ConfigurationParameterValues.Description: send 0x00 (OFF) when motion is detected and  0xFF (ON) when motion stops
ConfigurationParameterValues.DescriptionJSONSafe: send 0x00 (OFF) when motion is detected and  0xFF (ON) when motion stops

ConfigurationParameters.Name: Motion Binary Sensor Reports
ConfigurationParameters.Description: Decide whether the sensor should send binary sensor reports when motion is detected.

ConfigurationParameters.Name: Reporting Frequency
ConfigurationParameters.Description: Set the reporting frequency for battery, temperature, humidity, and light level. This is the minimum interval in which the sensor will send updates to the hub even if the reporting threshold isn’t met. The values entered correspond to the number of hours. Note: Frequent reports will affect battery life.

ConfigurationParameters.Name: Temperature Scale
ConfigurationParameters.Description: Choose if you'd like the sensor to report temperature in Celsius or Fahrenheit scale.

ConfigurationParameters.Name: Battery Reporting Threshold
ConfigurationParameters.Description: Set the battery reporting threshold (measured in percentage).

ConfigurationParameterValues.Description: doesn't report battery based on the reporting threshold
ConfigurationParameterValues.DescriptionJSONSafe: doesn't report battery based on the reporting threshold

ConfigurationParameters.Name: Temperature Reporting Threshold
ConfigurationParameters.Description:
Set the reporting threshold for temperature.
The sensor will report new temperature value to the hub whenever temperature changes by the number of degrees entered as value.

ConfigurationParameters.Name: Humidity Reporting Threshold
ConfigurationParameters.Description: Set the reporting threshold for humidity. The sensor will report new humidity value to the hub whenever humidity changes by the percentage number entered as value.

ConfigurationParameterValues.Description: disable humidity reporting based on environmental changes
ConfigurationParameterValues.DescriptionJSONSafe: disable humidity reporting based on environmental changes

ConfigurationParameters.Name: Lux Reporting Threshold
ConfigurationParameters.Description: Set the reporting threshold for lux. The sensor will report new lux value to the hub whenever the brightness level changes by the number of lux entered as value.

ConfigurationParameterValues.Description: disable lux reporting based on environmental changes
ConfigurationParameterValues.DescriptionJSONSafe: disable lux reporting based on environmental changes

ConfigurationParameters.Name: LED Indicator Mode
ConfigurationParameters.Description: Enable or disable LED indicator for motion alerts.

ConfigurationParameterValues.Description: don’t flash LED when motion is detected
ConfigurationParameterValues.DescriptionJSONSafe: don’t flash LED when motion is detected

ConfigurationParameterValues.Description: flash LED indicator when motion is detected
ConfigurationParameterValues.DescriptionJSONSafe: flash LED indicator when motion is detected

ConfigurationParameters.Name: Low Battery Alert
ConfigurationParameters.Description: Choose at which percentage level the sensor should send a low-battery alert to the hub.

Features.featureDescription: Enter the number of batteries of the designated type that the product uses.
Features.featurePrompt: Enter a number only for the number of batteries.

Texts.value:
Put your Z-Wave hub into inclusion mode and click the Z-Wave button 3 times as quickly as possible. The LED
indicator will start blinking to confirm inclusion mode and turn off once inclusion is completed. The sensor
will automatically pair as a repeater if connected to USB power, no special button sequence required.

1. Bring the sensor within direct range of your Z-Wave gateway (hub).
2. Put the Z-Wave hub into exclusion mode (not sure how to do that? ask@getzooz.com).
3. Press and release the Z-Wave button 3 times quickly.
4. Your hub will confirm exclusion and the sensor will disappear from your controller's device list.

The sensor’s wake-up interval is set to 4 hours by default to save battery life. Use the Wake Up Command Class to adjust the interval (in seconds, working in 3600s intervals, with 120 as min and 86400 as max values). Press and hold the ZWave button for 3 seconds to wake the sensor up manually. During wake-up, the sensor turns the Z-Wave radio for a couple of seconds to receive communication from the hub. Long wake-up interval will not affect how often the sensor reports motion or other values to your hub.

When your network’s primary controller is missing or otherwise inoperable, you may need to reset the device
to factory settings manually. In order to complete the process, make sure the sensor is powered, then press
and hold the Z-Wave button for at least 20 seconds.
The LED indicator will start flashing and turn solid on for a couple of seconds to indicate successful reset.
NOTE: All previously recorded activity and custom settings will be erased from the device’s memory.
